alert.note: Alert for Marion; Wyandot (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 1:15AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Marion and southwestern Wyandot Counties through 215 AM EDT... At 113 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Marseilles, or 7 miles southwest of Upper Sandusky, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Marion, Upper Sandusky, La Rue, Morral, Marseilles, New Bloomington, Green Camp, Harpster and Kirby. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
